meanings.sent1: The package was easily deliverable to the customer.
meanings.sent2: The letter was marked as deliverable by the post office.
meanings.sent3: The pizza delivery guy joked that even a rocket ship would find this package deliverable.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a deliverable promise of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The sunshine made the picnic a deliverable success.

meanings.sent1: The courier picked up the deliverable from the office.
meanings.sent2: The company's main deliverable is high-quality software.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to produce endless deliverables.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a deliverable of hope to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map led them to the ultimate deliverable - a chest of gold.

meanings.definition: A product or service that is provided to a client.
meanings.sent1: The marketing team presented the latest deliverable to the client.
meanings.sent2: The agency's deliverable exceeded the client's expectations.
meanings.sent3: The cat's deliverable was a mouse left on the doorstep.
meanings.sent4: Her advice was a deliverable that helped the client succeed.
meanings.sent5: The concert tickets were the most anticipated deliverable of the year.
